cves.description: When cache is enabled, some passdb/userdb drivers incorrectly cache all users with same cache key, causing wrong cached information to be used for these users. After cached login, all subsequent logins are for same user. Install fixed version or disable caching either globally or for the impacted passdb/userdb drivers. No publicly available exploits are known.
problemType: Improper Preservation of Consistency Between Independent Representations of Shared State

cves.description:
Sensitive data exposure via logging in basic-auth leads to plaintext usernames and passwords written to error logs and forwarded to log sinks when log level is INFO/DEBUG. This creates a high risk of credential compromise through log access.
It has been fixed in the following commit:  https://github.com/apache/apisix/pull/12629 
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.14, which fixes this issue.
problemType: CWE-532 Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
